capabilities.name: Display Resilience and Courage
capabilities.description: Leading large teams in dynamic environments requires resilience and the courage to make tough decisions.

capabilities.name: Act with Integrity
capabilities.description: Managing sensitive environmental and cultural heritage areas demands high ethical standards.

capabilities.name: Manage Self
capabilities.description: Self-management is crucial for balancing the diverse responsibilities of the role.

capabilities.name: Value Diversity
capabilities.description: Engagement with Aboriginal communities and managing diverse teams highlight the importance of valuing diversity.

capabilities.name: Communicate Effectively
capabilities.description: Effective communication is essential for leading teams and engaging with stakeholders.

capabilities.name: Work Collaboratively
capabilities.description: Collaboration with stakeholders and teams is key to achieving conservation and management goals.

capabilities.name: Influence and Negotiate
capabilities.description: Negotiating with stakeholders and influencing outcomes are critical for successful park management.

capabilities.name: Deliver Results
capabilities.description: The role requires efficient resource use and a commitment to quality outcomes in park management.

capabilities.name: Plan and Prioritise
capabilities.description: Strategic planning and prioritization are necessary for managing multiple park management operations.

capabilities.name: Think and Solve Problems
capabilities.description: Problem-solving is essential for addressing the complex challenges of park management.

capabilities.name: Demonstrate Accountability
capabilities.description: Accountability is crucial for managing public resources and achieving organisational objectives.

capabilities.name: Finance
capabilities.description: Strong financial management skills are needed to deliver critical insurance works and manage budgets.

capabilities.name: Project Management
capabilities.description: Effective planning, coordination, and control methods are required for managing park management programs.

capabilities.name: Manage and Develop People
capabilities.description: Leading and developing a large, multidisciplinary team is a core function of the role.

capabilities.name: Inspire Direction and Purpose
capabilities.description: Communicating goals and vision is essential for leading teams towards achieving conservation outcomes.

capabilities.name: Optimise Business Outcomes
capabilities.description: Resource management and workforce planning are key to optimizing outcomes in park management.

capabilities.name: Manage Reform and Change
capabilities.description: The ability to champion and manage change is important for implementing new strategies and programs.

skills.name: Strategic Leadership
skills.description: Leading teams and setting strategic direction for park management and conservation efforts.

skills.name: Financial Management
skills.description: Managing budgets and financial resources to deliver park management programs.

skills.name: Project Management
skills.description: Planning and executing park management and conservation projects.

skills.name: Stakeholder Engagement
skills.description: Engaging with Aboriginal communities, local stakeholders, and joint management boards.

skills.name: Conservation Planning
skills.description: Developing and implementing plans for environmental conservation and heritage management.

generalRole.title: Area Manager - Environmental Conservation
generalRole.description: This role involves leading and managing teams to implement park management programs, ensuring the conservation and protection of natural and cultural heritage within national parks. It requires a blend of strategic leadership, financial and project management, and stakeholder engagement skills.
